intro: Stachytarpheta sanguinea, commonly known as red sage, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red bracts that surround its small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly rough texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the branches. Stachytarpheta sanguinea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
